content:
#### M04 - Non Cancellation Clause
The Company undertakes to obtain consent of the Owners/Lessors specified in the Schedule prior to their cancellation of the Policy if instructions have been received for the cancellation of the Policy and also to advise the Owners/Lessors specified immediately of any other material changes which are proposed to be made in the Terms of this Policy.
questions: What is the purpose of the M04 - Non Cancellation Clause in the insurance policy?
Who must the Company obtain consent from before cancelling the policy according to the M04 clause?
What actions must the Company take if they receive instructions to cancel the policy?
What does the Company need to do if there are any material changes to the terms of the policy?
Who needs to be informed immediately about material changes in the policy terms?
What is the role of Owners/Lessors in the cancellation process of the policy?
What is specified in the Schedule mentioned in the M04 clause?
Does the M04 clause require the Company to notify Owners/Lessors about cancellations only, or also other changes?
What constitutes a 'material change' under the M04 - Non Cancellation Clause?
How does the M04 clause affect the rights of Owners/Lessors?
